intro: Gnidia oppositifolia, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and hardy nature. Gnidia oppositifolia is well adapted to arid conditions and thrives in full sun.
